title: Global McKinsey review warns banks need to innovate quickly
text:
Banks risk “becoming footnotes to history” as they lose market share to new players like fintech firms and tech giants, the report says, which operate at nearly half the cost of traditional financial institutions. It recommends that banks invest heavily in technology and pursue mergers to stay competitive. (The Logic)

Talking point: McKinsey & Company said the Canadian market is heading toward banking regulations that would support increased competition in the sector. High-level consultation is underway on open banking, which could give fintechs significantly more access to customer banking data held by traditional financial institutions. But McKinsey also said Canada is still in the early stages of adopting such regulations compared to most of Europe and parts of South America. An April report from the FinTech Growth Syndicate showed the creation of new Canadian fintechs has actually declined 72 per cent since 2014, thanks largely to a lack of open banking and the increasing number of financial products launched by traditional banks. One notable example is the automated investment industry—RBC, TD and BMO have all launched their own robo-advisers in the past few years.
